titleNullable: National Survey on Drug Use and Health 2021
subtitleNullable: To measure the prevalence & correlates of substance use & mental health issues
descriptionNullable:
NSDUH is sponsored by the **Center for Behavioral Health Statistics and Quality within the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
(SAMHSA)** and is conducted by **RTI International, Research Triangle Park, North Carolina**.

[https://www.samhsa.gov/data/release/2021-national-survey-drug-use-and-health-nsduh-releases](url)

Data is fetched from the above URL. My intention was to analyze the factors which lead to drug addiction in different geological sectors in the USA. But regarding the **geolocation** of the participant, the dataset only provides a qualitative measurement like "How big the county" is rather than giving a quantitative measurement.


The analysis runs on these mentioned substances' uses

1. Tobacco
2. Alchohol
3. Marijuana
4. Cocaine
5. Crack
6. Heroin
7. Hallucinogens
8. Inhalants
9. Methamphetamine
10. Pain Relievers Screener
11. Tranquilizers
12. Stimulants
13. Sedatives

The Survey data regarding mental health is not that useful since a lot of respondents are skipping the questions regarding personal mental health.

**Compatability with previous years**
On page i-9 said,

>Fourth, due to methodological issues, SAMHSA decided that the 2021 NSDUH estimates
are not comparable with estimates from 2020 or prior years.

**Data collection method**

>Because of the continued impact of COVID-19, the 2021 NSDUH used a combination of
web and in-person data collection methods
